description.narrative: To improve capacity of the Government of Lao to meet the challenges of the 8th NSEDP implementation and monitoring, formulation of 9th NSEDP eventually leading up to LDC graduation, MIC transition, and SDG achievement.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

receiver-org.narrative: Government of Lao People's Democratic Republ

Government of Lao People's Democratic Republ

description.narrative: 1.1.1 Availability of the national institutional mechanism for systematic capacity building of line ministries and the provincial governments on basic RBM concepts, focusing on results-based planning. 1.1.2 Number of line ministries and provincial governments that have increased knowledge of basic RBM and fully adopted results-based planning, monitoring and reporting. 1.1.3 Number of line ministries and provincial governments with increased knowledge of Medium Term Expenditure Framework (MTEF) concepts. 1.2.1 Availability of the national institutional mechanism for systematic capacity building of line ministries and the provincial governments on basic RBM concepts, focusing on results-based planning. 1.2.2 Extent to which policies, systems and/or institutional measures are in place at the national and sub-national levels to generate and strengthen gender-sensitive employment and livelihoods (UNDP SP Output Indicator 1.1.2). 2.1.1 Transition to the post-2020 Lao Development Forum that is fully consulted and officially adopted in line with the Vientiane Partnership Declaration (2016-2025). 2.1.2 Progress in implementation of the Vientiane Partnership Declaration Country Action Plan (2016-2025), in %. 2.2.1 Extent to which annual Round Table (Implementation) Meetings result in clear and measurable outcomes and indicators in the spirit of the Vientiane Partnership Declaration (2016-2025). 2.2.2 % of the Round Table process outcomes and indicators implemented through the Sector Working Groups and other relevant mechanisms. 3.1.1 Availability of a national roadmap for the achievement of SDGs by 2030 with costed Annual Work Plans and their implementation progress. 3.1.2 Extent to which the SDG Secretariat is able to coordinate information sharing, dialogue, engagement and cooperation on SDGs among the Government ministries/agencies, DPs, civil society and private sector in the spirit of “transparency and accountability to each other”. 3.2.1

comment.narrative: 1.1.1 There is no systematic training on RBM. 1.1.2 There is no systematic training on RBM. 1.1.3 There is no systematic training on RBM. 1.2.1 1 - not adequately 1.2.2 2 – very partially, there has been a national policy debate and an agenda for change agreed for policies, systems and institutional measures at the national or sub-national levels to generate and strengthen employment and livelihoods. 2.1.1 In its current form, the RTP is successful but will become increasingly irrelevant post-2020. 2.1.2 VD-CAP II is developed. 2.2.1 1 – not adequately; the outcomes are articulated without indicators to measure progress. 2.2.2 RTMs have stated outcomes but not systematically applied and followed up on. 3.1.1 The Prime Minister issued a decision on establishment of the National Steering Committee on SDGs under his leadership; 3.1.2 The Prime Minister issued a decision on establishment of the National Steering Committee on SDGs under his leadership; 3.2.1 1 - not adequately, general familiarity with the SDG indicators & targets exists but not on the way how to achieve them. 3.2.2 60% of 8th NSEDP indicators are linked to the SDGs, including those linked to LDC graduation. No linkage to the sectoral strategies done yet. 4.1.1 1 – not adequate, LaoInfo functions reasonably well but needs further improvements and strengthening; no metadata is publicly available; horizontal exchange of data among ministries is limited; information disaggregation needs improvement. 4.1.2 LSB with the assistance from PARIS21 conducted Mid-Term Review of the Strategy 4.1.3 LSB data are used by other ministries for planning and monitoring policy implementation, however data accessibility and sharing needs improvement. 4.2.1 The 5th NDHR on LDC graduation is prepared and launched. 4.2.2 The 5th NDHR on LDC graduation is prepared and launched; The SDG Baseline Report is under preparation.

1.1.1. The national Resource Group is established with the assigned staff for the Training of Trainers. The training curriculum is prepared and the national resource group conducted the first two trail training.
1.1.2. RBM training plan and arrangement for its implementation (at least 1 line ministry and 2 provinces with the assessment rate ≥ 4).
1.1.3. MTEF training plan and arrangement for its implementation (at least 1 line ministry and 2 provinces with the assessment rate ≥ 4).
1.2.1. 2 – very partially, a programme-based approach and sector wide approach concepts are adopted taking into account needs at national, provincial, district and village levels.
1.2.2. 3 – partially, policy reform or new and improved systems and institutional measures have been formally agreed and budgeted that are intended to generate and strengthen gender sensitive employment and livelihoods at national or sub-national levels.
2.1.1. To be discussed later stage *(subject to the LDC graduation by 2020). 2.1.2. 20% of VD-CAP II is implemented.
2.2.1. ≥3 - more than partially, RTM outcomes and indicators are set in consultation with all line ministries, DPs, civil society and private sector.
2.2.2. ≥80 % (RTM outcomes and indicators are properly monitored and reported against through SWGs and other relevant mechanisms).
3.1.1. A costed 2018 action plan of the National SDG Roadmap is up to date, approved and implemented through sectoral strategies/work plans and other mechanisms (as appropriate).
3.1.2. ≥3 – more than partially (the SDG Secretariat is well functioning with regular coordination and monitoring of the Annual Work Plan of the SDG Roadmap in a consultative and transparent manner).
3.2.1. A communication and training strategy is developed. ≥3 more than partial level of understanding is achieved through implementation of the communication and training strategy.
3.2.2. Finalisation of the SDG indicators and a preparation of the first SDG voluntary report for Lao PDR to be reported at the 2018 High Level Political Forum. 3 partially, sectoral strategies/work plans both at central and provincial levels partially incorporate the SDG targets and are formally approved with financial strategy, contributing to implementation of the National SDG Roadmap.
4.1.1. 3 – partially, LSB is on track in implementing its Action Plan and the LaoInfo Dashboard provide an up-to-date for the 8th NSEDP Midterm Review and any revision of the SDG targets with disaggregation on key target groups and areas.
4.1.2. 65% of SDNSS 2016-2025 is implemented.
4.1.3. ≥3 - partially.
4.2.1. 40% of NHDR recommendations feed into the policy acts/sectoral programmes/ legislation, targeting LDC graduation.
4.2.2. Cumulatively at least 3 high quality studies / research products / policy briefs are produced, filling the data gap for the 8th NSEDP / SDG targets monitoring.

1.1.1. Activities were put on hold in 2018 due to unavailability of fund 1.1.2. Activities were put on hold in 2018 due to unavailability of fund 1.1.3. Activities were put on hold in 2018 due to unavailability of fund
1.2.1. 1 to 4? - The 8th NSEDP M&E framework has been developed and it has been used to guide the mid-term review and it will continue to inform the formulation of the 9th NSEDP.
1.2.2. 1 to 4? - No data
2.1.1. No discussion made at this stage.
2.1.2. %? - Lao PDR has been participating in the third global survey to report on the progress made against various principles of the effective development cooperation agenda as agreed in Busan in 2011. The exercise is still on-going and the survey results will also be used to monitor and report on the implementation of the Vientiane Declaration on Partnership for Effective Development Cooperation (2016-2025).
2.2.1. 1 to 4? - Structure and format of the Round Table Meeting (RTM)/Round Table Implementation Meeting (RTIM) have also been revitalised to meet increasingly dynamic nature of development cooperation in the country.
2.2.2. Percent? - Key recommendations from the RTIM have been translated into an instruction of the Prime Minister to line ministries, provinces and agencies concerned.
3.1.1. A draft SDG roadmap which was shared with all government agencies in December 2018 based on recommendations made through the year.
3.1.2. 1 to 5? - The first Lao SDG report was prepared in 2018. A follow up from this report, the Government is now in the process of finalization of the SDG indicators.
3.2.1. A communication has been documented and shared with line ministries and partners for further comments. Workshops and training for SDG focal points at line ministries were organized at national and sectoral level.
3.2.2. Efforts in 2018 were on identifying and ensuring that ministries concerned understand SDG indicators. The current draft of the SDG roadmap is currently shared with partners at the national level and a plan will be to have it shared with provincial authorities to have clear timeline and milestones toward 2030.
4.1.1. With the establishment of LaoInfo which has now in place, the system has now been used as the primary vehicle for statistics dissemination.
4.1.2. In term of the implementation of the SDMSS, various partners have been working with LSB. The contribution of the programme was mainly ensuring proper coordination happened at the strategic level. Two meetings were organized.
4.1.3. Satisfaction survey was not done in 2018 due to limited budget. If fund is available in 2019, this activity will be carried out.
4.2.1. %? - Publication of two research papers as follow up from the publication of the Human Development Report in 2017.
4.2.2. Publication of the SDG report and mid-term review of the 8th NSEDP.

1.1.1 The training curriculum is prepared and the National Resource Group conducted the first two trail training. 1.1.2 RBM training plan and arrangement for its implementation (at least 1 line ministry and 2 provinces with the assessment rate ≥ 4). 1.1.3 TEF training plan and arrangement for its implementation (at least 1 line ministry and 2 provinces with the assessment rate ≥ 4) 1.1.4 partially, national and provincial work plans on 8th NSEDP achievement are monitored and reported based on Results-Based Management Principles. 1.2.1 largely, a change in policies, systems and/or institutional measures has occurred and is being demonstrably implemented at the national and sub-national levels aimed at generating and strengthening gender-sensitive employment and livelihoods. 2.1.1 40% of VD-CAP II is implemented. 2.2.1 largely, measural outcomes and indicators are set reflecting all relevant recommendations of line ministries, DPs, civil society and private sector. 2.2.2 90 % (RTIM outcomes and indicators are properly monitored and reported against through SWGs and other relevant mechanisms). 3.1.1 A costed 2019 Action Plan of the National SDG Roadmap is up to date, approved and implemented through sectoral strategies/work plans and other mechanisms (as appropriate). 3.1.2 largely, the SDG Secretariat is well functioning with regular coordination and monitoring of the Annual Work Plan of the SDG Roadmap in a consultatiive and transparent manner, ensuring active flow of information, dialogue, better coordination and stronger ownership among stakeholders. 3.2.1 ≥3 - more than partial level of understanding is achieved through implementation of the communication and training strategy. 3.2.2 ≥3 - more than partially, sectoral strategies/work plans both at central and provincial levels more than partially incorporate the SDG targets and are formally approved with financial strategy, contributing to implementation of the National SDG Roadmap with the preparation of the 9th NSEDP. 4.1.1 partially, LSB is on track in implementing its Action Plan and the LaoInfo Dashboard provides an up-to-date for the 8th NSEDP mid-term review and any revision of the SDG targets with disaggregation on key target groups and areas and a possibility to generate metadata. 4.1.2 80% of SDNSS 2016-2025 is implemented. 4.1.3 Partially, The level of satisfaction of the national/sub-national authorities and DPs with the quality of statistical products and their accessibility. 4.2.1 40% of NHDR recommendations feed into the policy acts/sectoral programmes/legislation, targeting LDC graduation; the 6th NHDR is prepared. 4.2.2 Cumulatively at least 10 high quality studies/research products/policy briefs are produced, filling the data gap for the 8th NSEDP/SDG targets monitoring and preparation for the next NHDR. 5.1.1 Unqualified audit report. 5.1.2 95% delivery rate and effective implemetation of communication strategy and capacity development plan. 5.1.3 Funding gap - 70% and third party cost sharing - 20% (mean for achieving these targets - Effective implementation of resource mobilisation strategy).

1.1.1. Not implemented because of the focus on NSEDP in 2020 1.1.2. Not implemented because of the focus on NSEDP in 2020 1.1.3. No achievement was made due to lack of funding 1.2.1. Partially achieved. Mid-Term Review of the 8th NSEDP (2016-2020) carried out in 2018 provided a platform for better understanding of relevant partners. The results were used in the formulation of the 9th NSEDP 1.2.2. No achievement was made due to lack of funding 2.1.2. seven (7) out of fourteen (14) VDCAP indicators have been monitored but no quantitative data was published yet 2.2.1. partially – the round table process provided the platform to address the current issues. All key recommendations have been translated into the Prime Minister’s Instruction to line ministries, provinces and partners to ensure the implementation. 2.2.2. 90% - the round table process provided the platform to address the current issues. All key recommendations have been translated into the Prime Minister’s Instruction to line ministries, provinces and partners to ensure the implementation. 3.1.1. Completed. The national SDG roadmap was endorsed by the Prime Minister of Lao PDR during the National SDG Steering Committee Meeting in June 2019, and it has been disseminated to all partners at all levels in 2020. 3.1.2. Largely achieved. The National SDG Secretariat has been the driving force to finalise the national SDG indicators, SDG communications plan, 2018 SDG Voluntary National Review (VNR) and SDG Mobile Application.
In 2020, the second VNR is in the process of development and data collection for all SDG indicators have been almost in final stage. 3.2.1. ≥3 partially, government officials and partners have been fully engaged in the SDG localisation process 3.2.2. ≥3- around 60% of SDG indicators have been integrated into the 8th NSEDP (2016-2020). On-going discussions have been made on how the rest of SDG indicators will be fed into the 9th and 10th NSEDPs 4.1.1- Partially achieved. Around one-third of all SDG indicators have baseline values and work is on-going to collect all data for all SDG indicators and those related to the NSEDP. SDG metadata is currently being developed. 4.1.2. On-going – but no data collected at this stage. 4.1.3. no assessment was conducted 4.2.1. The current (5th) NHDR was published in 2018. The development of the 6th NHDR has been postponed due to lack of funding. 4.2.2. two key research papers were produced and published to support the realisation of the 8th NSEDP and formulation of the 9th NSEDP. These papers include (i) Rural Development and Sustainable Poverty Reduction; and (ii) Policies supporting job creation and labour allocation into domestic industries in Lao PDR by 2025. 5.1.1. no unqualified audit report. 5 out of 8 audit recommendations were implemented. 5.1.2. no data 5.1.3. resource mobilization still not achieve the target

1.1.1. National capacity on results-based planning is systematically improved by the national Resource Group through the institutionalized curriculum (at least two extensive trainings a year)
1.1.2. 2 ministries and 5 provincial governments (with the assessment rate ≥4)
1.1.3. 2 ministries and 5 provincial governments (with the assessment rate ≥4) 1.2.1. 3 – partially, national and provincial work plans on 8th NSEDP achievement are monitored and reported based on Results-Based Management principles.
1.2.2. 3 - partially, policy reform or new and improved systems and institutional measures have been formally agreed and budgeted that are intended to generate and strengthen employment and livelihoods at national or subnational levels.
2.1.1. In progress – design of the post2020 Lao Development Forum concept is under development, taking into account feedback from all line ministries, DPs, civil society and private sector through expanded Sector Working Groups.
2.1.2. 30% of VD-CAP II is implemented.
2.2.1. 4 – largely, measurable outcomes and indicators are set reflecting all relevant recommendations of line ministries, DPs, civil society and private sector
2.2.2. ≥90 %
3.1.1. A costed 2019 Action Plan of the National SDG Roadmap is up to date, approved and implemented through sectoral strategies/work plans and other mechanisms.
3.1.2. 4 – largely: The SDG Secretariat is wellfunctioning with regular coordination and monitoring of the Annual Work Plan of the SDG Roadmap in a consultative and transparent way, ensuring active flow of information, dialogue, better coordination and stronger ownership among stakeholders.
3.2.1. 4 – large level of understanding is achieved through systematic communication and training. Authorities at all levels are able to contribute to the National SDG Roadmap implementation
3.2.2. ≥3 – more than partially, sectoral strategies/work plans both at central and provincial levels more than partially incorporate the SDG targets and are formally approved with a financing strategy, contributing to implementation of the National SDG Roadmap.
4.1.1. 3 – partially, LSB is on track in implementing its Action Plan and the LaoInfo Dashboard provides an up-todate monitoring data on the 8th NSEDP/SDG targets with disaggregation on key target groups/areas and a possibility to generate metadata
4.1.2. 80% of SDNSS 2016-2025 is implemented
4.1.3. y ≥3 – partially
4.2.1. 55% of NHDR recommendations feed into the policy acts/sectoral programmes/legisla tion, targeting LDC graduation.
4.2.2. Cumulatively at least 15 studies / high quality research products / policy briefs are produced, filling the data gap for the 8 th NSEDP / SDG targets monitoring.

1.1.1. RBM resource group was formed and TOR of the consultant was developed. However, other activities were put on hold to 2020 due to the budget constraint. 1.1.2. activities were put on hold to 2020 due to the budget constraint. 1.1.3. activities on the MTEF trainings were put on hold to 2020 due to the budget constraint. 1.2.1. 1-3? The Mid-Term Review (MTR) of the 8th NSEDP (2016-2020) was finalized and it is used as a guide to the implementation of the remaining period of the 8th NSEDP and the design of the 9th NSEDP. 1.2.2. activities were put on hold to 2020 due to the budget constraint.
2.1.1. No discussion at this stage, given the schedule of the process until 2024, following the eligibility announced in 2018. 2.1.2. In progress, VDCAP progress is currently monitored and reported through quarterly VDCAP secretariat meetings and RTiM. Currently, VDCAP indicators are integrated into the ODA-MIS.Gov.La. However, some activities such as trainings on the formulation and implementation of the PBA programme and the publication of the annual Foreign Aid Implementation Report have been putting on hold because of budget limitation. 2.2.1. In progress. Feedback from both national and international partners were included in the 8th NSEDP MTR and draft initial concept/outline of the 9th NSEDP and other documents. There is a clear link between RTP and SWG mechanism by having technical and executive meetings organized. 2.2.2. In progress, the RTP secretariat is developing the RTiM follow-up matrix consisting of various discussion points/ recommendations with appropriate follow up actions linking to line ministries/SWGs.
3.1.1. In progress, key SDG materials are prepared and revised have been prepared and revised based on inputs from SDG focal points through a series of consultation meetings. Annual retreat for the National SDGs secretariat was also a platform for the discussion on the implementation and the lesson learned. 3.1.2. In progress (see above) 3.2.1. To ensure proper monitoring and reporting on SDGs implementation, DIO/MOFA has been in the process of setting up and maintaining a reliable SDG database within the department. 3.2.2. Currently at the finalisation stage of the SDG indicators and metadata.
4.1.1. In progress, the provincial statistic database (LaoInfo) system was established in five (05) provinces. 4.1.2. Currently on hold due to limited financial resources. Only trainings were conducted. 4.1.3. Currently on hold due to limited financial resources. 4.2.1. Currently on hold due to limited financial resources. 4.2.2. Partially. “Structure Transformation and Economic Diversification in Lao PDR” and two (02) Quarterly Macro-Economic Reports on development situation (such as: LDC graduation matters, partnerships and SDGs, etc) were produced. Other reports were on hold due to budget limitation.
